sentences: Butrint Imeri (Albanian: [buˈtɾint iˈmɛɾi]; born 3 July 1996) is a Kosovo-Albanian singer, songwriter and dancer.
Life and career ==

section: == Life and career == | === 1996–present: Early life and continued success ===

sentences: 1996–present: Early life and continued success ===
section: == Life and career == | === 1996–present: Early life and continued success ===

sentences: Imeri was born on 3 July 1996 into an Albanian family in the city of Lörrach, Germany.
section: == Life and career == | === 1996–present: Early life and continued success ===

sentences: He started dancing at the age of 8 shortly after he enrolled in dance classes in his hometown.
section: == Life and career == | === 1996–present: Early life and continued success ===

sentences: Imeri first rose to national fame as he debuted with the singles, "Ki me lyp", "Merre zemrën tem" and "Eja Eja", with whom he received significant recognition in the Albanian-speaking Balkans.
section: == Life and career == | === 1996–present: Early life and continued success ===

sentences: He later released four additional singles, including "E jona" and "Delicious", the latter in collaboration with Greek singer of Albanian descent Eleni Foureira, which peaked at number five in Albania.
section: == Life and career == | === 1996–present: Early life and continued success ===

sentences: Imeri's chart success followed into 2017 with "Bella" and his first number one single in Albania "Xhanem".
section: == Life and career == | === 1996–present: Early life and continued success ===

sentences: In 2019, Imeri collaborated with Majk on "Sa gjynah" and reached number one in Albania.
section: == Life and career == | === 1996–present: Early life and continued success ===

sentences: Another pair of top ten singles in his native country, "Hajt Hajt" and "M'ke rrejt", followed in the same year.
section: == Life and career == | === 1996–present: Early life and continued success ===

sentences: "Dream Girl", a collaboration with German rapper Nimo released under 385idéal, was successful, including in Austria, Germany and Switzerland.
section: == Life and career == | === 1996–present: Early life and continued success ===

sentences: In 2020, Imeri collaborated with Albanian singer Ermal Fejzullahu on his follow-up single, "Për një Dashuri", which peaked at number two.
section: == Life and career == | === 1996–present: Early life and continued success ===

sentences: He further released "Si përpara" and "Dy zemra", the latter in collaboration with Albanian singer Nora Istrefi.
section: == Life and career == | === 1996–present: Early life and continued success ===

sentences: The follow-up release, "Phantom", went on to reach number one in Albania.
section: == Life and career == | === 1996–present: Early life and continued success ===

sentences: Artistry ==
Imeri's musical work is often defined as R&B and Pop.
He has cited Justin Timberlake as his major musical influence and stated that he is a fan of Elvana Gjata.
